title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: committed make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: experience witness behavior violates code conduct, please report package maintainers (). reports handled confidentially investigated promptly.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Benjamin Moran. Author, maintainer. Thomas Payne. Author, contributor.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Moran B, Payne T (2025). bayesfoRest: Forest Plots Bayesian Meta Analyses R. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://github.com/BLMoran/bayesfoRest.
code: @Manual{,   title = {bayesfoRest: Forest Plots for Bayesian Meta Analyses in R},   author = {Benjamin Moran and Thomas Payne},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://github.com/BLMoran/bayesfoRest}, }

title: Forest Plots for Bayesian Meta Analyses in R
text: bayesfoRest R package creating publication-ready forest plots Bayesian meta-analyses. provides comprehensive solution visualizing meta-analytic results support various effect measures, subgroup analyses, risk bias assessments.

title: Forest Plots for Bayesian Meta Analyses in R
text: Bayesian Forest Plots: Create forest plots brms models customizable aesthetics Multiple Effect Measures: Support , HR, RR, IRR, MD, SMD Subgroup Analysis: Built-support subgroup meta-analyses Risk Bias Integration: Seamlessly incorporate risk bias assessments (RoB2, ROBINS-, ROBINS-E, QUADAS-2) Shrinkage Visualisation: Display shrinkage effects density plots point intervals ROPE Support: Add Region Practical Equivalence (ROPE) plots Extensive Customisation: Colours, fonts, labels, layout

title: Forest Plots for Bayesian Meta Analyses in R
text: can install development version bayesfoRest GitHub:

title: Forest Plots for Bayesian Meta Analyses in R
code: bayes_forest(   model = model_bin,   data = binary_outcome,   measure = "OR",   xlim = c(0.1, 3.5) )

title: Forest Plots for Bayesian Meta Analyses in R
code: bayes_forest(   model = model_bin,   data = binary_outcome,   measure = "OR",   subgroup = T,   xlim = c(0.1, 3.5) )

title: Forest Plots for Bayesian Meta Analyses in R
code: bayes_forest(   model = model_bin,   data = binary_outcome,   measure = "OR",   subgroup = T,   add_rob = T,   xlim = c(0.1, 3.5) )

title: Forest Plots for Bayesian Meta Analyses in R
code: bayes_forest(   model = model_bin,   data = binary_outcome,   measure = "OR",   subgroup = T,   add_rob = T,   add_rob_legend = T,   rob_tool = "rob2",   xlim = c(0.1, 3.5) )

what: Exclude Studies with High Risk of Bias
title: Forest Plots for Bayesian Meta Analyses in R
code: bayes_forest(   model = model_bin,   data = binary_outcome,   measure = "OR",   subgroup = T,   add_rob = T,   add_rob_legend = T,   rob_tool = "rob2",   exclude_high_rob = T,   xlim = c(0.1, 3.5) )

title: Forest Plots for Bayesian Meta Analyses in R
code: # Create standalone RoB visualization rob_plot(   data = binary_outcome,   rob_tool = "rob2",   add_rob_legend = TRUE )

title: Forest Plots for Bayesian Meta Analyses in R
text: use bayesfoRest research, please cite:
code: @Manual{,   title = {bayesfoRest: Forest Plots for Bayesian Meta-Analyses in R},   author = {[Benjamin Moran and Thomas Payne]},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://github.com/BLMoran/bayesfoRest}, }

title: Forest Plots for Bayesian Meta Analyses in R
text: bayesfoRest depends several R packages: brms Bayesian model fitting metafor meta-analysis preparation gt creating tables patchwork combining plots ggplot2 plotting ggdist density plotting tidybayes tidy workflow dplyr, tidyr, purrr data manipulation paletteer colour palettes fontawesome risk bias icons

title: Forest Plots for Bayesian Meta Analyses in R
text: welcome feedback, suggestions, issues contributions. Please feel free contact either Ben Tom feedback. bugs, please file minimal code example reproduce issue. Pull requests can made . Please note bayesfoRest project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

title: Forest Plots for Bayesian Meta Analyses in R
text: package licensed GPL-3 License.

title: Forest Plots for Bayesian Meta Analyses in R
text: bayesfoRest builds upon excellent work brms , metafor, gt, patchwork, ggdist, tidybayes tidyverse suite packages. Without work R community contributions, bayesfoRest possible.

what: Create Bayesian Forest Plot for Meta-Analysis — bayes_forest
title: Create Bayesian Forest Plot for Meta-Analysis — bayes_forest
text: function creates Bayesian forest plot meta-analysis using data prepared metafor fitted brms model. supports various effect measures can handle single subgroup analyses customizable visualization options.

title: Create Bayesian Forest Plot for Meta-Analysis — bayes_forest
code: bayes_forest(   model,   data,   measure,   studyvar = NULL,   year = NULL,   c_n = NULL,   i_n = NULL,   c_event = NULL,   i_event = NULL,   c_mean = NULL,   i_mean = NULL,   c_sd = NULL,   i_sd = NULL,   c_time = NULL,   i_time = NULL,   sort_studies_by = "author",   subgroup = FALSE,   sort_subgroup_by = "alphabetical",   label_outcome = "Outcome",   label_control = "Control",   label_intervention = "Intervention",   title = NULL,   subtitle = NULL,   title_align = "left",   xlim = NULL,   x_breaks = NULL,   add_rope = FALSE,   rope_value = NULL,   rope_color = "grey50",   shrinkage_output = "density",   null_value = NULL,   color_palette = NULL,   color_study_posterior_null_left = "deepskyblue",   color_study_posterior_null_right = "violet",   color_study_posterior = "dodgerblue",   color_study_posterior_outline = "blue",   color_overall_posterior = "blue",   color_pointinterval = "purple",   color_shrinkage_outline = "purple",   color_shrinkage_fill = NULL,   plot_width = 4,   add_rob = FALSE,   rob_tool = c("rob2", "robins_i", "quadas2", "robins_e"),   add_rob_legend = FALSE,   exclude_high_rob = FALSE,   font = NULL )

title: Create Bayesian Forest Plot for Meta-Analysis — bayes_forest
text: model fitted brms model object (class 'brmsfit') containing Bayesian meta-analysis results. data data frame containing study data used meta-analysis. measure Character string specifying effect measure. Must one : "" (Odds Ratio), "HR" (Hazard Ratio), "RR" (Risk Ratio), "IRR" (Incidence Rate Ratio), "MD" (Mean Difference), "SMD" (Standardized Mean Difference). studyvar Column name containing study identifiers/authors. Default NULL. year Column name containing publication years. Default NULL. c_n Column name containing control group sample sizes. Required , RR, MD, SMD. i_n Column name containing intervention group sample sizes. Required , RR, MD, SMD. c_event Column name containing control group event counts. Required , RR, IRR. i_event Column name containing intervention group event counts. Required , RR, IRR. c_mean Column name containing control group means. Required MD, SMD. i_mean Column name containing intervention group means. Required MD, SMD. c_sd Column name containing control group standard deviations. Required MD, SMD. i_sd Column name containing intervention group standard deviations. Required MD, SMD. c_time Column name containing control group time periods. Required IRR. i_time Column name containing intervention group time periods. Required IRR. sort_studies_by Character string specifying sort studies. Options: "author" (default), "year", "effect". subgroup Logical indicating whether create subgroup analysis. Default FALSE. sort_subgroup_by Character string vector specifying subgroup ordering. Options: "alphabetical" (default), "effect", custom character vector subgroup names. label_outcome Character string outcome label. Default "Outcome". label_control Character string control group label. Default "Control". label_intervention Character string intervention group label. Default "Intervention". title Character string plot title. Default NULL (title). subtitle Character string plot subtitle. Default NULL (subtitle). title_align Character string specifying title alignment. Options: "left" (default), "center"/"centre", "right". xlim Numeric vector length 2 specifying x-axis limits. Default NULL (auto-scaled). x_breaks Numeric vector specifying custom x-axis break points. Default NULL (uses measure-specific defaults). add_rope Logical indicating whether add ROPE (Region Practical Equivalence). Default FALSE. rope_value Numeric vector length 2 specifying ROPE range, single value symmetric range around null. Default NULL (uses Kruschke's recommendations: /HR/RR/IRR = c(0.9, 1.1), SMD = c(-0.1, 0.1), MD requires specification). rope_color Color ROPE shading. Default transparent grey. shrinkage_output Character string specifying shrinkage visualization. Options: "density" (default) "pointinterval". null_value Numeric value specifying x-axis value null line. Default NULL (uses measure-specific defaults). color_palette Character vector colors plot. Default NULL. color_study_posterior_null_left Color left side null study posteriors. Default "deepskyblue". color_study_posterior_null_right Color right side null study posteriors. Default "violet". color_study_posterior Color study posterior densities. Default "dodgerblue". color_study_posterior_outline Color study posterior outlines. Default "blue". color_overall_posterior Color overall posterior. Default "blue". color_pointinterval Color point intervals. Default "purple". color_shrinkage_outline Color shrinkage plot outlines. Default "purple". color_shrinkage_fill Color shrinkage plot fill. Default NULL. plot_width Numeric value specifying relative width plot component. Default 4. add_rob Logical indicating whether add Risk Bias assessment. Default FALSE. rob_tool Character string specifying RoB tool. Options: "rob2" (default). add_rob_legend Logical indicating whether add RoB legend. Default FALSE. exclude_high_rob Logical indicating whether exclude high risk bias studies refit model. Default FALSE. font Character string specifying font family use throughout plot. Default NULL (uses system defaults). Common options include "Arial", "Times New Roman", "Helvetica", "Georgia", etc. font must available system.

title: Create Bayesian Forest Plot for Meta-Analysis — bayes_forest
text: patchwork object containing complete forest plot study information table, density plots, effect size table.

title: Create Bayesian Forest Plot for Meta-Analysis — bayes_forest
text: function performs several key operations: Validates input parameters data structure Renames data columns based specified measure type Updates brms model necessary Handles Risk Bias data specified Creates either single subgroup forest plots Combines tables plots using patchwork Risk Bias functionality, data must contain columns named "D1", "D2", "D3", "Overall". exclude_high_rob = TRUE, studies "High" overall risk bias removed model refitted filtered data.

title: Create Bayesian Forest Plot for Meta-Analysis — bayes_forest
text: Author Name

title: Create Bayesian Forest Plot for Meta-Analysis — bayes_forest
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Basic usage with odds ratio forest_plot <- bayes_forest(   model = my_brms_model,   data = my_data,   measure = "OR",   studyvar = author,   year = year,   c_n = control_n,   i_n = intervention_n,   c_event = control_events,   i_event = intervention_events )  # Subgroup analysis with mean difference forest_plot_subgroup <- bayes_forest(   model = my_brms_model,   data = my_data,   measure = "MD",   studyvar = author,   c_n = control_n,   i_n = intervention_n,   c_mean = control_mean,   i_mean = intervention_mean,   c_sd = control_sd,   i_sd = intervention_sd,   subgroup = TRUE,   sort_subgroup_by = "effect" ) } # }

what: bayesfoRest: Creates forest plots for Bayesian meta-analyses — bayesfoRest-package
title: bayesfoRest: Creates forest plots for Bayesian meta-analyses — bayesfoRest-package
text: bayesfoRest creates forest plots Bayesian meta-analyses data prepared using metafor brms packages. addition forest plots, posterior probability plots generated overall effect heterogeneity parameter.

title: bayesfoRest: Creates forest plots for Bayesian meta-analyses — bayesfoRest-package
text: Maintainer: Benjamin Moran ben.moran@newcastle.edu.au (ORCID) Authors: Thomas Payne tompayne302@gmail.com (ORCID) [contributor]

what: Studies Comparing Medications on Post-Operative Nausea and Vomiting — binary_outcome
title: Studies Comparing Medications on Post-Operative Nausea and Vomiting — binary_outcome
text: Outcome data randomised controlled trials comparing anti-emetic medications (eg ondansetron, dexamethasone) comparator anti-emetics placebo PONV outcomes patients undergoing surgery.

title: Studies Comparing Medications on Post-Operative Nausea and Vomiting — binary_outcome
Studies Comparing Medications on Post-Operative Nausea and Vomiting — binary_outcome

Studies Comparing Truncal Blocks on Pain Outcomes — cont_outcome

what: Create Risk of Bias Plot — rob_plot
title: Create Risk of Bias Plot — rob_plot
text: Creates publication-ready risk bias assessment plot using gt tables, options single studies subgroup analyses.

title: Create Risk of Bias Plot — rob_plot
code: rob_plot(   data,   studyvar = NULL,   sort_studies_by = "author",   subgroup = FALSE,   sort_subgroup_by = "alphabetical",   rob_tool = c("rob2", "robins_i", "robins_e", "quadas2"),   add_rob_legend = FALSE,   font = NULL,   title = NULL,   title_align = "left",   subtitle = NULL )

title: Create Risk of Bias Plot — rob_plot
text: data data frame containing risk bias assessments required columns: Author, Year, D1, D2, D3, Overall. subgroup analysis, Subgroup column also required. studyvar Character string specifying study identifier variable (currently used). sort_studies_by Character string specifying sort studies. Options: "author" (default), "year", "effect". subgroup Logical indicating whether create subgroup plot (default: FALSE). sort_subgroup_by Character string vector specifying subgroup ordering. Options: "alphabetical" (default) character vector subgroup names desired order. rob_tool Character string specifying risk bias tool used. Options: "rob2" (default), "robins_i", "robins_e", "quadas2". add_rob_legend Logical indicating whether add legend explaining risk bias symbols (default: FALSE). font Character string specifying font family use plot. title Character string plot title. title_align Character string specifying title alignment. Options: "left" (default), "center"/"centre", "right". subtitle Character string plot subtitle.

title: Create Risk of Bias Plot — rob_plot
text: gt table object (patchwork composition legend added) containing risk bias plot.

title: Create Risk of Bias Plot — rob_plot
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Create sample data rob_data <- data.frame(   Author = c("Smith", "Jones", "Brown"),   Year = c(2020, 2021, 2022),   D1 = c("Low", "High", "Some concerns"),   D2 = c("Low", "Low", "High"),   D3 = c("Some concerns", "Low", "Low"),   Overall = c("Some concerns", "High", "High") )  # Create basic risk of bias plot rob_plot(rob_data)  # Create plot with legend and title rob_plot(rob_data,           add_rob_legend = TRUE,          title = "Risk of Bias Assessment",          subtitle = "Using RoB 2 Tool") } # }
